title: Hearing Zoe being able to one shot people kind of reminds me of something...

He's called a Tonberry.  Its a Final Fantasy enemy that has a habbit of about one shoting a party member.  He also has a cute little move that deals damaged based on the number of enemies that character has killed.  As in "remember grinding out enemies for experience and money?  Ya those ones  50 hours of game play ago?  Well now take damage for EVERY. SINGLE. ONE."  Their usually late game enemies so by the time you meet them you've always killed enough enemies for them to kill that party member 5 times over.

Passing through any area where one can spawn creates the same feeling of dread as playing Russian Roulet with only 1 empty chamber.

Tonberry. He has an attack called Chef's Knife that either deals massive damage or OHKO's a party member. And another called Karma that deals damage to you based on ** the amount of enemies you've killed**.
A weapon to rival Sans
No a weapon to rival Chara, it would do basically nothing to Sans.

Basically veigar.  Every minion and enemy he kills grants him bonus power.  At some point being able to one shot anyone.

His idea suggests that 'Tonberry' will scale based off of his how many kills his opponent has, not his own. A reference to one of the classic tonberry abilities from the series.

However, old Veigar did scale off of his opponents AP in which case he is similar to this concept to an extent!
